means: 发育不完全的，未成熟的

sentence.Network_en: They were given only rudimentary training in the job.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们仅仅受到过基本的职业训练。

sentence.Network_en: He has only a rudimentary knowledge of the subject.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对这一科只有初步的认识.

sentence.Network_en: I have only a rudimentary knowledge of chemistry.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只有些粗浅的化学知识.

entry.tran: 基本的;简陋的;不完善的
entry.def: Rudimentary things are very basic or simple and are therefore unsatisfactory.

example.ex: They are deprived of the ability to exercise the most rudimentary workers' rights.
example.tran: 他们被剥夺了行使最基本的工人权利的资格。

entry.def: Rudimentary knowledge includes only the simplest and most basic facts.

example.ex: He had only a rudimentary knowledge of French.
example.tran: 他对法语只是略知皮毛。
对经济学知识的初步掌握

means.word_mean: 1. being or involving basic facts or principles;
2. being in the earliest stages of development;
3. not fully developed in mature animals;

auth_sentence.content: Some of the apps include a rudimentary financial calculator.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some of the apps include a rudimentary financial calculator.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some of the apps include a rudimentary financial calculator.

auth_sentence.content: But as a rudimentary part of a child's education?
auth_sentence.res_content: But as a rudimentary part of a child's education?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But as a rudimentary part of a child's education?

auth_sentence.content: The mainly rudimentary movement has a balletic base.
auth_sentence.res_content: The mainly rudimentary movement has a balletic base.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The mainly rudimentary movement has a balletic base.

sentences.en: He has only a rudimentary knowledge of the subject.
sentences.cn: 他对这一科只有初步的认识。

sentences.en: I have only a rudimentary knowledge of chemistry.
sentences.cn: 我只有些粗浅的化学知识。

sentences.en: He has a rudimentary ability to read,but he can only read simple words.
sentences.cn: 他有基本的阅读能力,但他只能看懂简单的词。
